_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

accountNumber.description:
Bank's Account Number. Detailed information about all ISO 13616-compliant national IBAN formats is available
in [SWIFT IBAN Registry](https://www.swift.com/standards/data-standards/iban).

accountNumberType.description: Bank's Account Number type. A valid value is basic bank account number (BBAN) or international bank account number (IBAN).

fingerprint.description: A unique value to identify the Bank Account. It contains alphanumeric values.

last4.description: The last 4 digits of the bank account

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

accountNumberType.description: Bank's Account Number type. A valid value is basic bank account number (BBAN) or international bank account number (IBAN).

country.description: The contact country ISO Alpha-2 code

hash.description: A hash that can be used to compare multiple contacts for identical attribute values, excluding id, customer id, createdTime, updatedTime.

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

country.description: The contact country ISO Alpha-2 code

hash.description: A hash that can be used to compare multiple contacts for identical attribute values

description.description:
Your coupon description. When it is not empty this is used for invoice discount item description,
otherwise the item's description uses coupon's redemptionCode like 'Coupon "redemptionCode"'

expiredTime.description: The coupon's expiry time, must be greater than the issued time. Null or empty string will immediately expire the coupon.

invoiceIds.description: Invoice IDs coupon can be applied to

planIds.description: Plan IDs coupon can be applied to

productIds.description: Product IDs coupon can be applied to

subscriptionIds.description: Subscription IDs coupon can be applied to

amount.description: Total amount that was discounted by this Coupon

paymentToken.description:
A write-only payment token; if supplied, it will be converted into a
payment instrument and be set as the `defaultPaymentInstrument`. The
value of this property will override the `defaultPaymentInstrument`
in the case that both are supplied. The token may only be used once
before it is expired.

paymentCount.description: The number of approved payments for the customer

lastPaymentTime.description: The most recent time of an approved payment for the customer

invoiceCount.description: An auto-incrementing number based on the sequence of invoices. If set to 0, then this record is a Lead, otherwise is a Customer

revision.description:
The number of times the customer data has been modified.
The revision is useful when analyzing webhook data to determine if the change takes precedence over the current representation.

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

credentialTtl.description: The default lifetime of the credential in seconds

authTokenTtl.description: The default lifetime of the auth-token in seconds

resetTokenTtl.description: The default lifetime of the reset-token in seconds

otpRequired.description: Should OTP be required to exchange token
Should OTP be required to exchange this token

token.description: The session's token used for authentication

invalidate.description: Whether to invalidate token after exchange or not

oneTimePassword.description: The one time password sent via an email. Should contain digits only.

expiredTime.description: Session expired time. Defaults to one hour

amount.description: Average approved payment amount in Merchant's reporting currency

amountUsd.description: Average approved payment amount in USD

amount.description: Revenue amount in Merchant's reporting currency

name.description: The name of the custom field

type.description:
Type value    | Description
------------- | -------------
array         | An array of strings up to 255 characters, maximum size is 1000 elements
boolean       | true or false
date          | String of format "full-date" (YYYY-MM-DD) from RFC-3339 (full-date)
datetime      | String of format "date-time" (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ) from RFC-3339 (date-time)
integer       | Cardinal value of -2^31..2^31-1
number        | Float value. It can take cardinal values also which are interpreted as float
string        | Regular string up to 255 characters
monetary      | A map of 3-letters currency code and amount, e.g. {"currency": "EUR", "amount": 25.30}

additionalSchema.description:
Additional parameters which can be added according to type:

Parameter Name | Types         | Description
-------------- | ------------- | -------------
allowedValues  | string, array | List of allowed values
maxLength      | string        | Maximum allowed length for the string, 255 by default, up to 4000

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

type.description: A URI reference [[RFC3986](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986)] that identifies the problem type. It should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type. When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

width.description: Image width, applicable to images only

height.description: Image height, applicable to images only

isPublic.description: Is the file available publicly (without authentication). If true, the permalink in the _links section contains the public URL.

file.description: The file in base64 encoded format.

isPublic.description: The File visibility. If public a permalink is provided.

name.description: The file name used for downloading

url.description: The URL of the file to upload.

isPublic.description: The File visibility. If public a permalink is provided.

name.description: The file name used for downloading

field.description: The field name. Dot notation is used for nested object field names.

invoiceNumber.description: An auto-incrementing number based on the sequence of invoices for any particular customer.

subscriptionId.description: The related Subscription's ID if available, otherwise null

poNumber.description: Purchase order number which will be displayed on the invoice

notes.description: Notes for the customer which will be displayed on the invoice

afterAttemptPolicies.description: The policy on the attempt finishes

afterRetryEndPolicies.description: The policy on the retry ends

revision.description:
The number of times the invoice data has been modified.
The revision is useful when analyzing webhook data to determine if the change takes precedence over the current representation.

delinquentCollectionPeriod.description: Delinquent Collection Period - difference between paidTime and dueTime in days.

collectionPeriod.description: Collection Period - difference between paidTime and issuedTime in days.

dueReminderTime.description: Time past due reminder event will be triggered

dueReminderNumber.description: Number of past due reminder events triggered

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

issuedTime.description: Invoice issued time. Will be issued immediately if `null` or omitted.

dueTime.description: Invoice due time. Will be set same as `issuedTime` if `null` or omitted.

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

dueTime.description: Invoice due time. Will be set as current date-time if `null` or omitted.

documentType.description: Document type submitted for validation, only identity-proof type is analyzed in an automated manner

score.description: The calculated score that represents the % of confidence that this ID represents the given customer

containsImage.description: Flag that indicates if there is an image that contains a face on it

isIdentityDocument.description: Flag that indicates if this looks like and ID

isPublishedOnline.description: If there is an exact match found online

firstName.description: The customer first name if it was matched, null otherwise

lastName.description: The customer last name if it was matched, null otherwise

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth found on the document, null if not found

expiryDate.description: The expiry date found on the document, null if not found

issueDate.description: The issued date found on the document, null if not found

hasMinimalAge.description: Checks the minimal age, 21+ for USA and 18+ for all other countries. Null if dateOfBirth could not be determined.

subAffiliate.description: Lead Source's sub-affiliate also called a sub-id or click id in some circles (eg 123456)

salesAgent.description: Lead Source's sales agent (eg James Bond)

clickId.description: Lead Source's click id (may come from an ad server)

amount.description: The amount that the lead cost

scheduledTime.description: The time the payment is scheduled for collection

retryNumber.description: The position in the sequence of retries

bin.description: The card's bin (the PAN's first 6 digits)

panFingerprint.description: A unique value to identify the PAN regardless of expiration dates.  It contains alphanumeric values.

status.description:
Payment Card status.  When a card is `active` it means it has been used at least once for an approved transaction.
To remove a card from being in use, set it as `deactivated` (see the deactivation endpoint).

stickyGatewayAccountId.description: Default Gateway Account ID used for transactions

expirationReminderTime.description: Time expiration reminder event will be triggered

expirationReminderNumber.description: Number of expiration reminder events triggered

Skrill-Rapid-TransferInstrument.description: Skrill Rapid Transfer payment instrument object

afterAttemptPolicy.description: The policy on the attempt finishes

afterRetryEndPolicy.description: The policy on the retry ends

isUsed.description: Whether the token was already used
Whether the token was already used

accountNumber.description:
Bank Account Number. Detailed information about all ISO 13616-compliant national IBAN formats is available
in [SWIFT IBAN Registry](https://www.swift.com/standards/data-standards/iban).

isUsed.description: Whether the token was already used

accountNumberType.description: Bank's Account Number type. A valid value is basic bank account number (BBAN) or international bank account number (IBAN).

bin.description: Payment Card BIN (the PAN's first 6 digits)

price.description:
For the very simple price when it's fixed and does not depend on the quantity chosen by customer.

If the price is 0, it's free.

Flat-rate pricing is represented in a simple price per unit.
Some examples:

- $30 per unit
- $0.10 per transaction
- $50 per period

If the price is 0, it's free.

maxQuantity.description: If the value is `null`, it's assumed to be infinite.

brackets.description:
The price brackets, along with the price formula,
is used to calculate the amount to charge for the product on this plan on the invoice.

The "stairstep" example:

Price total | Max quantity | Description
------------|--------------|------------
$5          | 1            | 1
$13         | 5            | 2 to 5
$30         | null         | 6 or more

If someone bought 1 apple, it would be $5.

If someone bought 2 apples, it would be $13. For 2 to 5 apples, the price is $13 in any case.

price.description: If the price is 0, it's free.

maxQuantity.description:
If the value is `null`, it's assumed to be infinite.  It starts at the end of the previous bracket.
If there is no previous bracket, it starts at 1.

brackets.description:
The price brackets, along with the price formula,
is used to calculate the amount to charge for the product on this plan on the invoice.

The "tiered" example:

Price per apple | Max quantity | Description
----------------|--------------|------------
$5              | 1            | 1
$4              | 5            | 2 to 5
$3              | null         | 6 or more

If someone bought 1 apple, it would be $5.

If someone bought 2 apples, it would be $9. $5 per apple for the first apple, then $4 per apple for the 2nd to 5th apple.

price.description: If the price is 0, it's free.

maxQuantity.description:
If the value is `null`, it's assumed to be infinite.  It starts at the end of the previous bracket.
If there is no previous bracket, it starts at 1.

brackets.description:
The price brackets, along with the price formula,
is used to calculate the amount to charge for the product on this plan on the invoice.

The "volume" example:

Price per apple | Max quantity | Description
----------------|--------------|------------
$5              | 1            | 1
$4              | 5            | 2 to 5
$3              | null         | 6 or more

If someone bought 1 apple, it would be $5.

If someone bought 2 apples, it would be $8. For 2 to 5 apples, the price is $4 per apple.

price.description: If the price is 0, it's free.

maxQuantity.description:
If the value is `null`, it's assumed to be infinite.  It starts at the end of the previous bracket.
If there is no previous bracket, it starts at 1.

name.description: The plan name, displayed on invoices and receipts.

isActive.description: If the plan is not active, customers cannot subscribe to the plan.

productOptions.description: Name-value pairs to specify the product options.

recurringInterval.description: The service interval. For a one-time item, use `null`.

limit.description: The number of invoices this subscription will generate (if 1, it will not generate any beyond the initial subscription creation).  For example, set this property to `12`, when the `periodUnit` is month and the `periodLength` is 1, for a 1 year contract billed monthly.

trial.description: The trial. Set `null` if no trial.

price.description: The price of the trial. For a free trial, use `0`.

setup.description: The setup. Set `null` if no setup.

price.description: The price of a setup - 0 is a valid value (for free)

billingAnchor.description: The billing anchor settings for this plan.

subscriptionCount.description: Number of subscriptions associated with this plan

PlanBillingAnchor.description:
The billing anchor in conjunction with `billingTiming` allows to setup different billing use cases such as:

- Bill immediately when the service period _starts_
- Bill immediately after the service period _ends_
- Bill _interval of time_ before the service period _starts_
- Bill _interval of time_ after the service period _starts_
- Bill _interval of time_ before the service period _ends_
- Bill _interval of time_ after the service period _ends_

chronology.description: The chronology of the billing time relatively to the service period start.

PlanBillingTiming.description:
The billing timing in relation to the service period.
For `prepaid` plans the customer pays when the service period starts,
whereas, for `postpaid` plans, the customer pays when the service period ends.

formula.description:
The price formula determines what algorithm is used to calculate the invoice price based on a few factors,
- the quantity in the subscription (which may be variable if usage pricing, otherwise determined when creating the subscription)
- the price brackets data

To determine which formula is correct, please see the price formula documentation.

minOrderSubtotal.description: Minimum order subtotal for which this shipping rate is applicable, defaults to 0.00

maxOrderSubtotal.description: Maximum order subtotal for which this shipping rate is applicable (NULL if no maximum)

price.description: The shipping price - 0 is a valid value (for free)

Product.description:
Products include digital goods, services, and physical goods.
Products appear on invoice line items. If you set a tax category identifier,
taxes will be calculated upon invoice generation.  If it is shippable,
shipping will be calculated upon invoice generation.  Pricing and 
variations are set within Plans.

unitLabel.description: The unit label, such as per `seat` or per `unit`.

taxCategoryId.description: The product's tax category identifier string

requiresShipping.description: If the product requires shipping, shipping calculations will be applied

options.description: The product options such as Color, Size, etc.  The product options definition does not include option values.  Those are defined within the Plans.

ResourceCustomFields.description:
"Custom Fields list as a map `{"custom field name": "custom field value", ...}"`.
The format must follow the saved format (see Custom Fields section for the formats).

ResourceId.description: The resource ID. Defaults to UUID v4

isProxy.description: True if customer's ip address is related to proxy

isVpn.description: True if customer's ip address is related to VPN

isTor.description: True if customer's ip address is related to TOR

isHosting.description: True if customer's ip address is related to hosting

isp.description: Internet Service Provider name, if available

country.description: Country ISO Alpha-2 code for specified ipAddress

distance.description: Distance between IP Address and Billing Address geolocation (kilometers)

score.description: Risk score computed per all the factors

BillingScheduleInstruction.description:
The calculation instruction of billing time.
This is used in conjunction with the **service period anchor** to calculate the time the invoice is issued.

CommonScheduleInstruction.description: The calculation instruction of scheduled time

CustomEventScheduleInstruction.description: The calculation instruction of scheduled time

InvoiceRetryScheduleInstruction.description: The calculation instruction of scheduled time

day.description:
The day of the month when event will be scheduled.
Be aware if the month has less days,
the last day of the month will be selected.

ServicePeriodAnchorInstruction.description:
Instruction for calculating the service period anchor.
This is used in conjunction with the **subscription start** to calculate the time the service period starts and ends.

searched.description: Names of searched resources, even if they returned nothing

ServerTimestamp.description: Read-only timestamp, automatically assigned on back-end.

countries.description:
Countries covered by the shipping zone. A country can only belong to one shipping zone (no overlapping).
This property can be empty or null to create a default shipping zone for countries that were not specified in other zones.

orderType.description: Specifies the type of order, a subscription or a one-time purchase.

status.description:
The status of the subscription service. A subscription starts
in the `pending` status, and will become `active` when the
service period begins.

billingStatus.description:
The billing status of the most recent invoice.  It may
help you determine if you should change the service status
such as suspending the service.

initialInvoiceId.description: Unique id for the initial invoice

recentInvoiceId.description: Unique id for the most recently issued invoice. It might not be `paid` yet.

quantity.description: Number of units of the product on the given plan

billingAnchor.description:
The billing anchor settings to override plan settings. To use plan settings, set `null`.
To use multiple plans in one subscription they all must have the same billing period,
this property allows to subscribe to different plans.

recurringInterval.description:
The recurring interval to override plan settings. To use plan settings, set `null`.
To use multiple plans in one subscription they all must have the same recurring period length,
this property allows to subscribe to different plans.

autopay.description: Autopay determines if a payment attempt will be automatic

riskMetadata.description: Risk metadata. If null, the value would coalesce to the risk metadata captured when creating the payment token.

startTime.description: Subscription start time.  When the value is sent as null, it will use the current time. This value can't be in past more than one service period.

couponIds.description:
A list of coupons to redeem on the customer and restrict to this subscription.
Read more about [coupons here](https://help.rebilly.com/invoices-and-subscriptions/coupons-discounts).

This parameter respects the following logic:

- When not passed then applied coupons will not be changed.

- When empty array passed then all applied coupon redemptions will be canceled.

- When list of coupons is passed then not applied yet coupons will be applied, already applied coupons
will not change their state, applied coupons that are not presented in passed list will be canceled.

If list of applied coupons on pending subscription will be changed due to this param during update subscription,
 Invoice for the subscription will be reissued.

poNumber.description: Purchase order number, will be displayed on the issued invoices

renewalReminderTime.description: Time renewal reminder event will be triggered

renewalReminderNumber.description: Number of renewal reminder events triggered

trialReminderTime.description: Time renewal reminder event will be triggered

trialReminderNumber.description: Number of renewal reminder events triggered

revision.description:
The number of times the subscription data has been modified.
The revision is useful when analyzing webhook data to determine if the change takes precedence over the current representation.

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

status.description: Subscription status is deprecated and the values will change to `active`, `canceled`.
enum: Will become active at a future date
Active but set to cancel at next rebill date

inTrial.description: True if the subscription is currently in a trial period

trial.description: To use plan defaults do not send the `trial` key, or send a `null` value with it.

enabled.description: Enable or disable the trial for this subscription. If enabled for plans without trial prices, the trial will be free.

endTime.description: The time the trial should end

proratedInvoiceId.description: Identifier of the invoice on which the cancellation proration is calculated.

appliedInvoiceId.description: The identifier of the invoice where the cancellation fees or credits are applied.

description.description: Cancel reason description in free form

prorated.description:
Defines if the customer gets a pro-rata credit for the time remaining between `churnTime` and
subscription's next renewal time.

status.description:
"draft" defines that the cancellation isn't applied on an invoice and subscription but
can be inspected to see the charge.
"confirmed" will set a subscription to be canceled when the `churnTime` is reached.
"completed" is a read-only status which is set by the system when the churnTime is reached.
The cancellation may not be changed or deleted when the status is "completed".

canceledTime.description: The cancellation time (when the status is confirmed which is by default unless specified "draft").

createdTime.description: The time of resource creation (when it is posted).

churnTime.description: The time when the subscription will be deactivated.

lineItems.description: Items to be added to the new invoice. Proration item is generated and added automatically.

lineItemSubtotal.description: Subtotal of the line items which will be added after the subscription's cancellation

cancelDescription.description: Cancel reason description in free form

description.description: Reactivation reason description in free form

effectiveTime.description:
The date from which the service period would start, unless the subscription is canceled but still active.
In case the susbcription is still active, the subscription will continue the current service period.
If omitted, it will default to the current time.

renewalTime.description:
The time of the next subscription renewal. If omitted then it is computed from the effective time.
If the subscription is canceled but active it is ignored, so the next renewal will happen as scheduled.

createdTime.description: The time of resource creation (when it is posted).

lineItems.description: Subscription line items which queue until the next renewal (or interim) invoice is issued for the subscription.

lineItemSubtotal.description: Subtotal of line items in this subscription (signed value).  If credits exceed debits, it will be a negative number.

unitPriceAmount.description: Unit price of the line item

periodStartTime.description: Date-time when the period begins for this item

periodEndTime.description: Date-time when the period ends for this item

createdTime.description: Date-time when the item was added to the subscription

renewalPolicy.description: The value determines whether the subscription retains its current `renewalTime` or resets it to a newly calculated `renewalTime`.

prorated.description:
Whether or not to give a pro rata credit for the amount of time remaining between the `effectiveTime` and the end of the current period.
In addition, if the `renewalTime` is retained (by setting the `renewalPolicy` to `retain`), then a pro rata debit will occur as well,
for the amount between the `effectiveTime` and the `renewalTime` as a percentage of the normal period size.

effectiveTime.description: The date from which the renewal time (for `reset` operations) and proration calculations are made.  If omitted, it will default to the current time.

preview.description: If set to true, it will not change the subscription.  It allows for a way to preview the changes that would be made to a subscription.

transactionId.description: If present, applies a payment to the invoice created.  If the payment is for the invoice total, it would be marked as paid.

name.description: The tag's unique name, which is case-insensitive.

eci.description: The 3D Secure entry electronic commerce indicator

cavv.description: The 3D Secure entry cardholder authentication verification value

payerAuthResponseStatus.description: The 3D Secure entry Auth Response Status

customEventType.description: Timeline custom event type. Used with `custom-event` type. Must be defined using [Customer Timeline custom event API](#operation/PostCustomerTimelineCustomEventType)

customData.description: Timeline custom event data. Used with `custom-event` type. Will be transformed to `extraData` two-column table in response

triggeredBy.description: Shows who or what triggered the Timeline message

message.description: The message that describes the message details

id.description: Customer Timeline Custom Event identifier string

name.description: Customer Timeline Custom Event type name. It must not be similar to any Rebilly system event.

createdTime.description: Customer Timeline Custom event created time

updatedTime.description: Customer Timeline Custom event updated time

triggeredBy.description: Shows who or what triggered the Timeline event

message.description: The message that describes the message details

triggeredBy.description: Shows who or what triggered the Timeline message

message.description: The message that describes the message details

data.description: Table data. Each array element represents a table row

actions.description: Actions available to a Timeline message. Can be empty in case no actions are available for a message

triggeredBy.description: Shows who or what triggered the Timeline message

message.description: The message that describes the message details

data.description: Table data. Each array element represents a table row

RedirectUrls.description: The redirect URIs, now deprecated.  Use `redirectUrl` instead.

enrolled.description: Is the cardholder enrolled in 3D Secure

authenticated.description: The 3D Secure entry Auth Response Status

requestAmount.description: The transactions's amount received in the payment request

invoiceIds.description: The invoice IDs related to transaction

subscriptionIds.description: The subscription IDs related to transaction's invoice(s)

planIds.description: The plan IDs related to transaction's subscription(s)

originalCode.description: The raw, unmapped gateway's response code

originalMessage.description: The raw, unmapped gateway's response message

gatewayName.description: Payment Gateway name, available only when transaction use gateway, else null

acquirerName.description: Acquirer name, available only when transaction use gateway, else null

velocity.description: The number of transactions by the same customer in the past 24 hours

revision.description:
The number of times the transaction data has been modified.
The revision is useful when analyzing webhook data to determine if the change takes precedence over the current representation.

hasDcc.description: True if transaction has Dynamic Currency Conversion applied

dcc.description: Dynamic Currency Conversion detailed information. Null if hasDcc is false

base.description: Initial amount and currency to convert from

quote.description: Suggested amount and currency to convert to

usdMarkup.description: The amount of markup translated to USD

hasBumpOffer.description: True if transaction has a Bump offer

bumpOffer.description: Bump offer information. Null if hasBumpOffer is false

usdOrder.description: The amount of initial amount translated to USD

usdBump.description: The amount of bump amount translated to USD

usdBonus.description: The amount of bonus amount translated to USD

version.description: The name of the version that was picked (useful for measuring split tests)

language.description: The language of the bump offer that was displayed to user (useful for finding any translation problems)

notificationUrl.description:
The URL where a server-to-server POST notification will be sent.  It  will be sent when the
transaction's result is finalized after a timeout or an offsite interaction. Do not trust the
notification; follow with a GET request to confirm the result of the transaction. Please
respond with a 2xx HTTP status code, or we will reattempt the request again.

redirectUrl.description: The URL to redirect the end-user when an offsite transaction is completed.  Defaults to the website's configured URL.

retryNumber.description: The position in the sequence of retries

isRetry.description: True if this transaction is retry.

billingDescriptor.description: The billing descriptor that appears on the periodic billing statement. Commonly 12 or fewer characters for a credit card statement.

isReconciled.description: True if the transaction has been verified with gateway batch data

hadDiscrepancy.description: True if the transaction has been updated due to a disprepancy with its source of truth

orderId.description: The transactions's order ID.  This ID must be unique within a 24 hour period. This field was renamed to the `requestId`.

requestId.description: The transactions's request ID.  This ID must be unique within a 24 hour period. Use this field to prevent duplicated transactions.

scheduledTime.description: The time the transaction is scheduled for collection

_embedded.description: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.

type.description:
The type of transaction requested.
You should always include the type within your API request.
This supports a limited subset of Transaction types.  To refund or void, use the refund endpoint.
To `capture` use the `sale` endpoint.  It will capture if there are any eligible
transactions of type `authorize` that can be captured.

amount.description:
The transaction amount.  Use `0` for a zero dollar verification. This is important if
you want to authorize a payment instrument before giving access to a free trial, for example.

invoiceIds.description:
The array of invoice identifiers.  It's important to note that the transaction
amount can be more or less than the combined invoice amounts.  If the transaction
is a type `sale` and it is `approved` it will be applied to these invoices in
the order of the first issued invoice to the most recently issued invoice.  If
there are enough funds to fully pay an invoice, the invoice status will be marked
as paid.

billingAddress.description: Billing Address. If not supplied, we use the billing address associated with the payment instrument, and then customer.

requestId.description: The request id is **recommended**. It prevents duplicate transaction requests within a short period of time. If a duplicate request is sent with the same `requestId` it will be ignored to prevent double-billing anyone.  It must be unique within a 24-hour period.  We recommend generating a UUID v4 as its value.

notificationUrl.description:
The URL where a server-to-server notification request type `POST` with a transaction payload will be sent
when the transaction's result is finalized. Do not trust the notification;
follow with a `GET` request to confirm the result of the transaction.  Please respond with a `2xx`
HTTP status code, or we will reattempt the request again.

redirectUrl.description: The URL to redirect the end-user when an offsite transaction is completed.  Defaults to the website's configured URL.

resourceName.description: The ACL resource name. Send `null` to match all resources.

methods.description: The HTTP methods allowed for this resource. Send `null` to match all methods.

permissions.description: Specify individual permissions here if creating a restricted API key. Send `null` to allow all permissions.

planId.description: Checkout page plan ID.  If the plan is deactivated, the submit button on the checkout page will be deactivated and the page will display "Sold Out."

urlPathSegment.description: Your own custom url path segment for this Checkout Page. It will be appended to checkout url https://checkout.rebilly.com/checkout/`urlPathSegment`

name.description: Checkout page name, used for internal display to help you organize your various checkout pages.

redirect.description: After a successful checkout, the customer can optionally be redirected to a url of your choice.

url.description: After a successful checkout, the customer can be redirected to a url of your choice.  If left empty, the customer will remain on the thank you page.

timeout.description: The time (in seconds) that the customer will remain on the thank you page before being redirected to the corresponding `url`.

isCustomCustomerIdAllowed.description: Set to true if you want to supply your own customer ID's in a querystring parameter on your checkout page.

isBillingAddressHidden.description: Set to true if you want to hide billing address on your checkout page.

isPlanSummaryHidden.description: Set to true if you want to hide plan summary on your checkout page.

isPreCheckedTerms.description: Set to true if you want to pre-checked checkbox of terms on your checkout page.

oneTimeOffer.description: One time offer for checkout page.

isTiedToQuantity.description: Set to true if you want to tie one time offer to quantity on your checkout page.

thankYouOneTimeOffer.description: One time offer for thank you page.

isTiedToQuantity.description: Set to true if you want to tie one time offer to quantity on your checkout page.

hasProration.description: Set to true if you want to pro rata credits given due change a subscription's plan.

theme.description: Select from pre-designed themes for your checkout page.

quantityLabel.description: Checkout page quantity label, used in case you want to customize the quantity field label.

quantityType.description: Checkout page quantity type, used in case you want to customize the quantity field type.

quantityMin.description: Checkout page quantity min, used in case you want to set the minimun quantity.

markup.description:
Sections of styled content that will display within the page body, keyed by "section."
The themes rely on specific "section" key values, for example "header", "button", "footer", "body", "thank-you", "terms".

fields.description: Take granular control over the default field settings.  You can make specific fields hidden, optional, or required.  You can specify labels and default values.

taxes.description: Taxes, you can specify description and list of name-value items.

status.description: If `inactive`, the checkout page url will result in a 404.

name.description: The name of the field, as defined in our APIs. You can also include custom fields.

setting.description:
If you want the field hidden, optional, or required.  Some fields may be required by a specific theme, and these settings will not override that.
Defaults are that most fields are shown.  You may wish to hide `couponCode`, if you don't use coupons.  You may wish to require specific fields
that are optional (eg `phoneNumber`).

label.description: If you want to override the default label, you can set a value here (eg, instead of "First Name", you can set "Given Name").

default.description: Set a default value for the field.  It will default to being empty, or 1 for `quantity`.

section.description: A key for this section of content.

style.description: Control the font and background colors.

content.description: The text you want to appear in the section, can be styled in html markup.  You can include image references.

enabled.description: Set to false if you want to disable this markup section on checkout page.

background.description: Background color for the section in hexadecimal format.

color.description: Font color for the section in hexadecimal format.

chronology.description: The emitting time of the custom event relatively to the system event

deactivationTime.description: The time when the credential was deactivated

id.description: The email delivery setting's identifier string

credentialId.description: SMTP or any Email Service Provider credential identifier string.

credentialHash.description: SMTP or any Email Service Provider credential identifier string.

to.description: The email message's recipients address list

cc.description: The email message's CC address list

bcc.description: The email message's BCC address list

_links.description: The links related to the resource

count.description: The count of binds with `send-email` actions per event
The count of binds with `send-email` actions per event

merchantCategoryCode.description: The gateway account's merchant category code

dccMarkup.description: Dynamic currency conversion markup in basis points

dccForceCurrency.description:
Force dynamic currency conversion to the specified currency on each sale.
Leave it empty to disable force DCC.

cityField.description: The gateway account's city field (also known as line 2 descriptor)

excludedDccQuoteCurrencies.description: Excluded Dynamic Currency Conversion Quote Currencies

approvalWindowTtl.description: The time window (in seconds) allotted for approving a suspended transaction before it is automatically canceled

dynamicDescriptor.description: True, if Gateway Account allows dynamic descriptor

acceptedCurrencies.description: Accepted currencies (array of the currency three letter code)

isDown.description: True if gateway is currently in downtime period.

additionalCriteria.description: The additional criteria that allows to check whether the gateway account can be selected for the transaction to be processed.

timeout.description: Gateway Account request timeout in seconds

user.description: User (used for refund, void and capture)

password.description: Password (used for refund, void and capture)

banks.description: list of banks which will show on hook page

skipStep.description: Skip step for user to enter their personal information.

coNumber.description: Chase Gateway CO Number used for delimited file reports

visaPayoutsClient.description: DataCash Gateway client for Visa payouts (OCT)

visaPayoutsPassword.description: DataCash Gateway password for Visa payouts (OCT)

masterCardPayoutsClient.description: DataCash Gateway client for MasterCard payouts (OCT)

masterCardPayoutsPassword.description: DataCash Gateway password for MasterCard payouts (OCT)

platform.description: eMerchantPay platform to process payment. default to IPG

recipientHolder.description: Account holder of the recipient account

sandbox.description: True if gateway account is in sandbox mode

apiUserId.description: Username for the Alliance API (transaction reporting)

apiSecurityToken.description: Hash of the password for the Alliance API (transaction reporting)

useIpFrame.description: Force Ilixium to process via Ip Frame

extraStep.description: Show extra step for user to enter their email and DNI number

subdomain.description: Subdomain to use when sending request to IpayOptions.

mobilePay.description: MTA Pay Gateway mobile pay param

payformCode.description: Onlineueberweisen payform code to use customized Payform template

extraStep.description: Show extra step for user to enter their ID number

convertToAscii.description: Will convert all chars to ascii

user.description: If you set up one or more additional users on the account, this value is the ID of the user authorized to process transactions. If, however, you have not set up additional users, USER has the same value as VENDOR

vendor.description: Your merchant login ID created when you registered for the account.

password.description: The password you defined while registering for the account.

apiUserId.description: Username for the Alliance API (transaction reporting)

apiSecurityToken.description: Hash of the password for the Alliance API (transaction reporting)

delay.description: Rotessa Gateway time delay for them to process transaction

accountEmail.description: Email address of your Skrill merchant account

secretWord.description: Secret word used for MD5 signature verifications

businessSignature.description: Wirecard Gateway merchant business case signature

id.description: The Gateway Account downtime schedule identifier string

status.description: The Gateway Account downtime schedule status

reason.description: The Gateway Account downtime schedule reason

startTime.description: The Gateway Account scheduled downtime start time.

endTime.description: The Gateway Account scheduled downtime end time.

eventsFilter.description: An array of System event type

url.description: URL that will be triggered when the given event occurs.

credentialHash.description: Hash from Credentials which is used for authentication by the given URL

count.description: The number of available rule sets

name.description: The name of the layout string

items.description: The array of layout items (planId and starred)

starred.description: Boolean if the plan should be starred (special callout presentation)

rel.description: The authentication URL where the merchant should be redirected to grant the requested access

deactivationTime.description: The time when the credential was deactivated

fromSupport.description: Indicates that note was ceated by support user

archived.description: Is the note archived (excluded from List method)

deactivationTime.description: The time when the credential was deactivated

service.description: The name of service that the OAuth2 credential belongs to

code.description: The OAuth2 code provided by the authentication server

country.description: The organization country ISO Alpha-2 code

taxDescriptor.description: The organization's tax label. This will be displayed on the invoice.

invoiceTimeZone.description: Invoice will use this time zone to display time otherwise UTC will be used. Example "America/New_York"

isPrimary.description: True, if Organization is primary (available to set as true only, other organizations will become as isPrimary=false)

fromGatewayAccountId.description: An ID of Gateway Account cards should be migrated from

toGatewayAccountId.description: An ID of Gateway Account cards should be migrated to

items.description: An array of payment card IDs

migratedCards.description: Number of cards that were successfully migrated

deactivationTime.description: The time when the credential was deactivated

availableCurrencies.description: An array of reporting currencies enabled for the merchant

reportingCurrency.description: The user's ISO Alpha-3 code used for reports

totpRequired.description: The user setting of two-factor authentification

totpSecret.description: The user TOTP key for authentification app (if TOTP enabled)

totpUrl.description: The user link to QR-code for TOTP authentification app (if TOTP enabled)

oneTimePassword.description:
The one time password generated by Google Authenticator (required when enabling/disabling 2FA).
Should contain digits only.

country.description: The user country setting - two letter code

preferences.description: User preferences like timezone, language and many more. This is an object with custom properties.

ttl.description: Blacklist TTL. Defaults to zero, meaning blacklist record won't expire ever.

role.description: The role of Reminder (available only on Subscription events, other events should use `all`).

request-kyc.description: Request KYC page to verify customer identity

excludePolicy.description: Who should be excluded from the verification

promptPolicy.description: When to prompt, before or after processing the transaction

rejectedBeforeTransactionProcessPolicy.description: What to do if verification is before transaction processing, and is rejected

alternateGatewayAccountIfRejected.description: Gateway account to use if use-alternate-gateway is selected for rejectedBeforeTransactionProcessPolicy

rejectedAfterTransactionProcessPolicy.description: What to do if verification is after transaction processing, and is rejected

optionalPolicy.description: What to do if verification is optional

alternateGatewayAccountIfOptional.description: Gateway account to use if allow-use-alternate-gateway is selected for optionalPolicy

bypassCurrencyToDisplay.description: The currency three letter code to display on the bypass link, if optional

role.description: The role of Reminder (available only on Subscription events, other events should use `all`).

afterAttemptPolicies.description: The policy on the attempt finishes

afterRetryEndPolicies.description: The policy on the retry ends

overrideRetryInstruction.description: Whether to replace the existing retry or not

allOf.description: The calculation instruction of scheduled time for payment

role.description: The role of Reminder (available only on Subscription events, other events should use `all`).

title.description: The title of the messages. (This title will appear in reports.)

tag-or-untag-customer.description: Tag or untag a customer with specified list of tags

addingTags.description: The list of tag ID customer should be tagged with

removingTags.description: The list of tag ID customer should be untagged from

final.description: Whether rule is final, meaning stop further matching rules if this is matched

credentialHash.description: SMTP or Mailgun credential identifier string.

version.description: The message version. (By default is empty, but if you make multiple versions, you can name or number them to distinguish them.)

from.description: The sender address. The template placeholders are allowed.

to.description: The recipients addresses. The template placeholders are allowed.

cc.description: The recipients addresses. The template placeholders are allowed.

bcc.description: The hidden recipients addresses. The template placeholders are allowed.

subject.description: The message subject. The template placeholders are allowed.

text.description:
The message's text body.
Leave empty to use content from "bodyHtml".
The template placeholders are allowed.

html.description:
The message's html body.
Leave empty to use content from "bodyText".
The template placeholders are allowed.

editor.description:
The source of the message required for the email editor.
Not used for sending emails.
Used by the editor to reproduce the message for future updates.

resourceId.description: The attachment's resource identifier string. The template placeholders are allowed.

RuleSet.description: Set of rules for particular event

_links.description: The links related to a resource

ReminderScheduleInstruction.description: The calculation instruction of scheduled time

isVisible.description: Toggle whether this Segment is visible to the current user

data.description:
An object containing schema to set up the UI for the segment. This schema is built
and consumed by the frontend. It includes such information as Segment name, UI settings, etc.

isVisible.description: Toggle whether this Segment is visible to the current user

userIds.description: A list of user id's with whom to share, used if scope is set to `shared`

users.description:
A list of user's id and first and last names with whom this Segment
is shared

scope.description:
If `private`, then only the owner/creator can view this Segment. If set
to `public`, then it's shared with anyone in the owner's organization.
If set to `shared`, then it is only shared with specific users as specified
in the `userIds` field

deactivationTime.description: The time when the credential was deactivated
The time when the credential was deactivated

configurationSetName.description: The configuration set name which will be used durring email sending

SESCredential.description: Amazon simple email service (AWS SES) credential

token.description: The session's token used for authentication

permissions.description: The session's permissions. See the format in example

expiredTime.description: Session expired time. Defaults to one hour

oneTimePassword.description: One time password for 2 factor authentication. Should contain digits only.

expiredTime.description: Session expired time. Defaults to one hour

reportingCurrency.description: The currency to be set only once which will be used for conversion in reports

status.description: The API status. If everything is ok - value is 'ok'

triggeredBy.description: Shows who or what triggered the Timeline message

message.description: The message that describes the message details

user.description: The user who has made a request

userAgent.description: The software that is acting on behalf of a user

message.description: It contains the transaction number and renewal time

method.description: HTTP method which was used to send webhook

headers.description: HTTP headers which were used to send webhook

currentPassword.description: Current user's password - used when requesting password change

newPassword.description: New user's password - used when requesting password change

password.description: User's password. If not provided, password reset email will be sent

permissions.description: The user's permissions. See the format in example

reportingCurrency.description: The user's ISO Alpha-3 code used for reports

availableCurrencies.description: An array of reporting currencies enabled for the merchant

totpRequired.description: The user setting of two-factor authentification

totpSecret.description: The user TOTP key for authentification app (if TOTP enabled)

totpUrl.description: The user link to QR-code for TOTP authentification app (if TOTP enabled)

country.description: The user country setting - two letter code

preferences.description: User preferences like timezone, language and many more. This is an object with custom properties.

deactivationTime.description: The time when the credential was deactivated

servicePhone.description: The website's customer service phone number

serviceEmail.description: The website's customer service email address

items.description: The number of requests per each method.

aggregationValue.description: Date in format YYYY-MM (monthly aggregation) or YYYY-MM-DD (daily aggregation)

newCount.description: Number of new subscriptions within the aggregation

canceledCount.description: Number of canceled subscriptions within the aggregation

cumulativeCount.description:
Number of cumulative subscriptions from the previous aggregation +
number of new subscriptions - number of canceled subscriptions within the aggregation.

planId.description: Plan id for which the aggregation is given

newCount.description: Number of new subscriptions within the aggregation

canceledCount.description: Number of canceled subscriptions within the aggregation

cumulativeCount.description:
Number of cumulative subscriptions from the previous aggregation +
number of new subscriptions - number of canceled subscriptions within the aggregation.

currency.description: Currency (three letter ISO 4217 alpha code) (eg USD, EUR)

revenueAmount.description: Sum of overall sales and captures that were approved

increaseIsGood.description: True when the higher value means a better performance thus positive for a merchant, false otherwise

value.description: Segment value for the given date range

previousValue.description: Segment value for the previous date range (relative to the given date range)

humanValue.description: Human readable segment value (formatted with a currency sign)

changeRatio.description: Ratio of current value per previous value null is infinity

humanChangeRatio.description: Human readable change ratio (formatted percentage with a "%" sign), null is infinity

resource.description: The type of resource being exported (eg., transactions).

arguments.description: Export request arguments that can be passed to filter and/or sort the result set. See the [arguments guide](https://docs-reconciliation.rebilly.com/getting-started/arguments) for more options and examples.

filter.description: The collection items filter requires a special format. Use "," for multiple allowed values. Use ";" for multiple fields.

sort.description: The collection items sort field and order (prefix with "-" for descending sort).

q.description: The partial search of the text fields.

dateRange.description: The date range (can be in relative formats).  If omitted, all time will be included. See the [Date Range guide](https://docs-reconciliation.rebilly.com/getting-started/date-range) for more options and examples.

start.description: Any valid datetime arguments including [relative datetime arguments](http://php.net/manual/en/datetime.formats.php).

end.description: Any valid datetime arguments including [relative datetime arguments](http://php.net/manual/en/datetime.formats.php).

field.description: The field to apply date range to.

emailNotification.description: List of emails to be notified when export is completed

fields.description: List of fields to include in the export.  See supporting documentation for more info.  If omitted, default fields will be included.

recurring.description: Exports can reoccur according to your own schedule

instruction.description: RRule RFC 5545 formatted string used for recurring exports

start.description: The date and time when the first recurring scheduled export will occur. Defaults to now.

userId.description: The ID of the User who requested the data export

recordCount.description: The number of records in the export (excluding the header row)

scheduledTime.description: The date and time this data export is scheduled to generate a file

createdTime.description: The time the data export was requested

aggregationValue.description:
Value by which the report provides aggregated data.
The date values are displayed as following: Day: YYYY-MM-DD; Month: YYYY-MM.

selectedCount.description: Number of selected offers in the aggregation

selectedSum.description: Amount of selected offers in the aggregation

rejectedCount.description: Number of rejected offers in the aggregation

rejectedSum.description: Amount of rejected offers in the aggregation

unknownCount.description: Number of offers in the aggregation which weren't selected nor rejected

unknownSum.description: Amount of offers in the aggregation which weren't selected nor rejected

sum.description: Amount of future renewals in user's reporting currency

aggregationFieldValue.description:
Selected aggregation field value (defined by query). It can be, for example, website or country.
You define it in aggregationField param in query.

aggregationValue.description:
Selected aggregation field value (defined by query). It can be, for example, website or country.
You define it in aggregationField param in query.

items.description: Contains a report of payments successful retries throughput

subscriptionsCount.description: Number of subscriptions created within the aggregation

items.description: The period for the given aggregation

period.description: Retention period (0 - first, 1 - second etc) since the beginning boundary of the aggregation

retentionRatio.description:
Ratio % of remaining subcriptions (not canceled) at the moment of retention period
to all subscriptions created in the aggregation period

canceledSubscriptionsCount.description: Number of canceled subscriptions within the given retention period

customersCount.description: Number of customers within the aggregation with their first payment

items.description: The period for the given aggregation

period.description: Retention period (0 - first, 1 - second etc) since the beginning boundary of the aggregation

retentionAverage.description:
Summary amount of all transactions for all periods up to the current one
divided by the aggregation customers number

transactionsCount.description: The number of transactions happened in the retention period (e.g. in 3 rebills)

transactionsValue.description: The amount of transactions (income transactions - loss transactions)

revenueGrowthPercentage.description: Revenue growth (in percents) in last 24 hours (against previous 24 hours)

customers.description: New customers count in last 24 hours

customersGrowthPercentage.description: Customers count growth (in percents) in last 24 hours (against previous 24 hours)

cancelsGrowthPercentage.description: Cancels count growth (in percents) in last 24 hours (against previous 24 hours)

refundsGrowthPercentage.description: Refunds count growth (in percents) in last 24 hours (against previous 24 hours)

authApprovedThroughput.description: Approved auth transactions to all transactions percentage

approvedThroughput.description: Approved sale transactions to all transactions percentage

disputesRate.description: Disputed transactions to all approved sale and capture transactions percentage

disputesCount.description: Disputed transactions to all approved sale and capture transactions count

averageLength.description: Average length of canceled subscription from start to end within the aggregation in seconds

medianLength.description: Median length of canceled subscription from start to end within the aggregation in seconds

planId.description: Plan identifier for which subscriptions are counted

paidRenewalCount.description: Number of paid renewed subscriptions. Divide by allRenewalCount to know the renewal success rate

paidDunningCount.description: Number of paid dunned subscriptions. Divide by allDunningCount to know the dun success rate

refundedRenewalCount.description: Number of paid renewed subscriptions. Divide by allRenewalCount to know the renewal refund rate

refundedDunningCount.description: Number of paid dunned subscriptions. Divide by allDunningCount to know the dun refund rate

chargebackRenewalCount.description: Number of paid renewed subscriptions. Divide by allRenewalCount to know the renewal chargeback rate

chargebackDunningCount.description: Number of paid dunned subscriptions. Divide by allDunningCount to know the dun chargeback rate

recurringAmount.description: Recurring amount of the related plan

recurringCurrency.description: Recurring currency of the related plan

rebillNumber.description: Number of rebill cycle of the renewal

paymentDunningIndex.description: Dunning index of the related payment

isInitial.description: Whether it is the first renewal of the subscription or not

refund.description: Contains data for the related refund transaction if it exists

chargeback.description: Contains data for the related chargeback (dispute) if it exists

lead.description: Related lead source if it exists

currency.description: Currency (three letter ISO 4217 alpha code) (eg USD, EUR)

invoicedAmount.description: Sum of all issued, past due, or paid invoices

invoiceCount.description: Number of issued, past due, or paid invoices

total.description: Amount or count of all transactions within the aggregation

subaggregates.description: Subaggregates which have appropriate transactions within the range

value.description: Amount or count of the subaggregate's transactions within the aggregation
